emuInput.TitMainTitle: President Dwight D. Eisenhower, speaking at podium in Hunt Armory, another version
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 13, 1956, pg. 2, reads: "The President Speaks - Above is one section of the crowded Hunt Armory where President Eisenhower (inset right) declared on Oct. 9: 'I will not promise that winning a peace based on justice will be cheap and easy.' William P. Young (inset left) is pictured in his plea for election of President Eisenhower and the entire Republican ticket.  Doors were closed at 7:30 P. M. compelling an estimated crowd of 5,000 people to remain outside the Armory to hear the President's nationally televised address at 9 P. M.  The President was introduced by U. S. Senator James H. Duff. - Harris Photo."
